last_episode_to_air.name: A New Era
last_episode_to_air.overview: Anger about social injustice infuses Latin American rock after the Zapatista uprising, paving the way for reggaeton and rap and new female rockers.

name: BREAK IT ALL: The History of Rock in Latin America
original_name: Rompan todo: La historia del rock en América Latina
overview: Soda Stereo, Café Tacvba, Aterciopelados and others figure in this 50-year history of Latin American rock through dictatorships, disasters and dissent.

seasons.name: Miniseries
seasons.overview: Soda Stereo, Café Tacvba, Aterciopelados and others figure in this 50-year history of Latin American rock through dictatorships, disasters and dissent.

episodes.name: The Rebellion
episodes.overview: Latin America's rock movement was sparked by Ritchie Valens' "La Bamba" and the Beatles but found its own voice in youth and resistance to dictatorship.

episodes.name: The Repression
episodes.overview: When the band Peace and Love began chanting, "We got the power!" at the first rock festival in Mexico in 1971, the government responded by banning rock.

episodes.name: Music in Color
episodes.overview: After the fall of the Argentine dictatorship in 1983 and the Mexico City earthquake in 1985, rock explodes with ingenuity. And it's all in Spanish.

episodes.name: Rock in Our Own Language
episodes.overview: Argentina's Soda Stereo was the first all-hemispheric hitmakers, followed by Mexico's Caifanes and Los Prisioneros from Pinochet's Chile.

episodes.name: One Continent
episodes.overview: Mexico's Café Tacvba fuses rock and folk traditions while Aterciopelados, rising with MTV Latin America, does the same with Colombian beats and sounds.

episodes.name: A New Era
episodes.overview: Anger about social injustice infuses Latin American rock after the Zapatista uprising, paving the way for reggaeton and rap and new female rockers.
